runs.comm: good length outside off, de Villiers follows it - as he did in Durban - and this time guides a couple wide of third man
lashed through point for four! Quicksilver hands from de Villiers, given a bit of width and he happily cracked it for the first boundary of the day
back of a length, moves across and whips a bottom-handed jab to mid-on
in the channel, de Villiers drops back and glides one more to third man
dug in at 134kph, rising outside off as de Kock plays an angled bat, checks a pull down into the leg side
length ball, straighter line and de Kock is off the mark with a dab through backward square leg
shortish on the hips, tucked away for one more
length ball, angled in towards off stump, de Villiers defends to the on side
skips out and WHACK! Down the wicket and flashes across the line, everything coming together smoothly as de Villiers deposits Hastings on to the grass banks at deep midwicket

banged in and de Villiers gets in a tangle trying to pull... did that come off the glove on its way through? Hastings and Nevill were pretty convinced but umpire Shaun George less so. Looks like it came straight off the forearm
short outside off, goes back and swings hard on the cut, fails to connect

bowled him, no doubt this time! De Villiers plays on, there'll be no Wanderers mauling this week... Tight lines from Hastings and de Villiers was trying to force it off the back foot, got a thick inside edge into off stump
dug in short, de Kock tries to pull and gets hit on the shoulder
fired down the leg side
short ball from Hazlewood and this is crumped through midwicket on the pull for de Kock's first boundary
nicely bowled, cranking up the pace and the ball nibbles back past the inside edge
back of a length and hits de Kock on the body as he tries to work to leg
hoicked over midwicket for four more! This was a decent length ball from Hazlewood, no width on offer but de Kock manufactured an angle to hit to leg
short ball, shovelled away through backward square leg and a good diving stop prevents four more
off the mark straight away, opening the face outside off
back of a length, de Kock knocks it back in the direction of the bowler
extra pace on this, 143kph from Hastings and it flies through past an airy swipe from de Kock
flipped around the corner, cute shot from de Kock, moving across and sending a length ball over short fine leg and away for four
misses again with a big ole yahoo down the ground
short outside off, de Kock again attempts to hit the cover off it, fails to connect. Hastings demanding respect
130kph nibbler on off stump, du Plessis taps it away
gets in tight to the stumps, length ball pushed into the covers coming forwards
du Plessis steps to leg and tries to make room, ends up clearing cover with a leading edge as Marsh followed him... couple more to the total
middle and off, du Plessis works it to mid-on but has to send his partner back
full and spanked! Du Plessis sashays out and drills aerially over extra cover, disappeared in a trice

length ball on leg stump... and it's been flicked into the crowd at deep square leg! Flamboyant stuff from Faf, a flamingo flick and it fair flew, well beyond the man standing on the rope - that rather spoiled an otherwise decent start from Marsh
skips out to hit Hazelwood off his length, clears mid-on and that'll bounce away
drags it a little shorter and this is hammered on the up over midwicket, back-to-back fours for Quinny

oh my word! That's extraordinary... This time he targets the off side, opens up his body and launches an uppercut over the covers, it sails through the thin Highveld air several metres back into the crowd. Woof!
short ball at the body, nudged away to leg
drops back and cuts wide of third man for two
length ball outside off, du Plessis goes hard at it and gets a thick inside edge through backward square leg for a couple more
round the wicket, pushed through on off stump, tapped away
slightly short and de Kock crunches a pull through square leg, quickly into position to dispatch it for four
goes again, too short and straight from Maxwell, rocks back and slams it to the deep square leg boundary
floated up a bit slower, pushed into the off side
tossed up outside off, goes back to cut but finds the fielder at backward point
full on leg stump, de Kock gets down low to sweep, sends the ball skimming away wide of short fine leg - third four in the over
length outside off, du Plessis stays in the crease and swats through point
slower ball, out the back of the hand and this deceives de Kock, who plays and misses
length ball outside off, drops back and dabs to backward point... and Marsh's throw isn't far from catching out de Kock as he scrambled back to his crease
another legbreak from Faulkner, steered through point to the sweeper
on the stumps and punched down the ground

bowled him, de Kock is chopped down! Looked like he played around a full toss but Faulkner is happy either way... It was full and straight, he tried to clip to leg and got an inside edge on to his stumps
tossed up on the stumps and worked through midwicket
presses forward and taps into the off side
angled in from round the wicket, Duminy goes back and flicks one through midwicket to get going
over the wicket, tapped back to the bowler
dobbly offbreak on the stumps, comes forward and punches down the ground
goes deep in the crease and manufactures the angle to whip another single through midwicket
over the wicket, good length on off, Duminy comes forward and pushes to mid-off

stumps broken at both ends! But no one is out... Duminy's bobbly drive was somehow deflected on to the stumps at the non-striker's end by du Plessis, but he managed to get his bat in; Faulkner then threw down the wicket at the other end but Duminy was safe
slower ball, Duminy picks it a marches out to drive regally over the top for four
flicked to leg, in the air... but just short of the diving Smith at midwicket, bounced in front of his fingertips and squeezed through for a couple
good full bunger, Duminy has to dig it out
goes back outside off and steers a length ball to backward point
sliding down the leg side, that'll be a wide... actually, Marsh has flicked the non-striker's bails off, so it's a no-ball
takes the pace off... and du Plessis then puts it all back on, whipping a wristy pull into the stands, really got hold of it, landed on an awning some way up at deep square leg
on the stumps, worked into the leg side and they come racing back for two
length ball on the stumps, Faf steps away and drives into the covers
another slower ball, tapped down into the covers
short ball, Duminy latches on to it and carts a pull high and handsome, comfortably beyond the boundary at deep square leg - that's the SA 100 up in style

similar ball, similar shot - but this time he picks out deep midwicket! Duminy hangs his head in frustration, it was a half-tracker there to be hit but he seemed to get it off the toe of the bat and it went straight and true to the man stationed on the fence
tossed up from round the wicket, Miller nurdles it away to leg
over the wicket, on the stumps, bobbled away to leg
switches back to round the wicket, worked off the legs for one more
tossed up outside off, du Plessis crouches to bunt through cover point

Miller walks down the pitch, attempts to play to leg again, the ball deflects off glove and pad, I think, and ends up going behind him... he has to dive back sharpish to prevent a smart stumping from Nevill
floated up on middle and leg, Miller comes forward and works one through mid-on to keep the strike
stately high arm from Agar, flighted outside off, chipped down the ground for one
drags his length down, du Plessis clips through midwicket, he wanted two but Maxwell raced in from long-on to deny them
flat on the stumps, Miller works one down the ground
pushed through on middle and leg, du Plessis backs away and slaps through cover point
floated up outside off stump, Miller picks out cover on the drive
full length, cracked back past the bowler, straight drive along the ground but not out of the middle and long-off keeps them to a single
drops a little short outside off and Miller crashes a Ming the Merciless cut through point
darted on the legs, swatted away through backward square
tossed up and du Plessis paddles one to backward square leg
flighted on the stumps, Miller tries to sweep hard but doesn't really get hold of it
du Plessis gives it the charge, launches Maxwell towards wide long-off, not going to reach the rope but it lands in front of the fielder
on the stumps, Miller is down early again to sweep one through backward square
length ball, whipped through midwicket on the pull and they pick up two
ambles in and tosses it up on off stump, Miller clumps a drive down the ground, flat and hard through long-on for four
goes a little short - and Miller goes big in response! Swipes a Popeye blow down the ground, forearms bulging as it sails over long-on
dragged down and Miller cracks it wide of long-on, nearly another boundary but it's stopped a yard in front of the rope
immense! Miller beats his chest like King Kong and then scrambles up the Empire State Building with Agar in his hand... Another breezy swing and the ball disappears into the crowd at long-on again!

goes for another maximum but finds long-off! The bat skewed in the hands slightly, got under the shot and Maxwell positioned himself safely underneath to give Agar his maiden T20I wicket. Kong has been downed
back of a length, worked away off the legs
short ball, outside off, dragged through midwicket on the pull
angled in on the stumps, driven down the ground to long-on
back of a length in the channel, Behardien drops into the crease and steers through point
good length, whipped back through mid-on, dealing in singles at the moment
excellent finish to the over, Hastings gets it up in the blockhole and Behardien can only block it back to the bowler
gets this wrong, a slower ball but well wide of the tracks
pushed across the right-hander from over the wicket, du Plessis drives through the covers
full and straight, can only dig it out down the ground - that's the SA 150
back of a length, no room to swing the arms, du Plessis can only shovel one to leg

hit out or get out... and Behardien is gone! It was a full toss, out the back of the hand, Behardien was at least trying to do some damage but he caught it off the toe of the bat and holed out to deep midwicket
length ball angled outside off, du Plessis steers it through cover point
another slower ball, Morris doesn't really get hold of it, in the air and bouncing down to long-on
full and tailing towards leg stump as Morris backs away, can only chop it into the ground
brings out the du-scoop! Faf finds the boundary, gets down low outside off stump and ramps a full delivery straight over the keeper and away... We've not seen much of that today
back-to-back boundaries to the same part of the ground, this time via an inside edge! Made room to drive and picked up four more via a French cut - they all count
punched into the covers, that'll be fifty for du Plessis, his seventh in T20Is
shaping away as Morris stands and swings... called wide
back of a length outside off, Morris slaps it to cover
full length, 140kph just outside off, dug out for a quick single into the covers

slogged into the deep and taken! Morris aims for the big boomer over extra cover but doesn't quite have the power required and Warner leaps to take it above his head... A standing slap from Morris, who fails to cash in this time
full and wide, possibly a slower ball, du Plessis mistimes a drive, ballooning over cover but it's squarer than Morris' shot and lands between two fielders
oh yes, he's nailed this one! Smoked back down the ground, hang time from du Plessis, the ball peppering the upper tiers again
full on the stumps and clubbed through midwicket
pitched up on the toes, flicked firmly off leg stump and Wiese hurtles back for a second
goes for the blockhole again, slightly leg side and Wiese bunts it in front of long-on for a couple - but those are pretty nifty figures from Faulkner, 3 for 28 from his allocation
full and straight but somehow du Plessis has managed to hack it away for four through square leg
boshed! Hastings misses his length and du Plessis plants another on into the crowd, a mighty swing over cover
slower ball, on the stumps - and crashed over deep midwicket this time! A flat six to keep the good times rolling for the home fans
lashed through point, this will be another boundary! Du Plessis opened up his stance and larruped a full ball flat and hard square
picks out deep midwicket! The fun is over for Faf! Full toss does the job for Hastings, this time du Plessis didn't quite get hold of it and he found the man in the deep

yes they can, what a strike from Wiese! He puts this in the top tier with a straight drive down the ground, a Thor-like hammer blow to finish the innings and take South Africa to a handy-looking 204. Hastings wipes his brow, having conceded 26 off the over
